title: [K-12] Deep Learning Assessment Competency Enhancement Course in Social Studies for Blended Learning Environments: Civic Competency and Social Problem-Solving Application Cases

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy, elementary social studies teaching experience, foundational understanding of social institutions and cultural diversity, and basic concepts of civic rights and responsibilities
context.additional_context: Acquiring methods to evaluate blended learning (online-offline) effectiveness in social studies within smartphone-centric limited technological environments: application of real social contexts such as community problem-solving, civic competency enhancement, and multicultural understanding promotion. Special focus on fostering learners' critical thinking and social responsibility through integrated approaches in history, geography, and economics.

learning_goals: Learners will design one assessment tool measuring higher-order social studies thinking (historical event analysis, cultural context evaluation, creative problem-solving) in a blended learning environment (online+offline) during a one-week intensive course, and present a civic competency enhancement case meeting over 3.5 points (5-point scale) via peer feedback and instructor evaluation

Learners will complete three social studies vocational training scenarios (e.g., community issue resolution, multicultural conflict mediation, civic participation projects) in a VR simulation environment within one week, and submit a self-assessment checklist (participation, problem-solving ability, skill application, civic consciousness) scoring at least 3 points per item (total 12+ points) on a 5-point scale

Trainees will design one project-based assessment task (e.g., local history research, policy proposal writing) promoting reflective learning in social studies within one week, and submit a final report incorporating peer feedback (from ≥2 peers) and instructor evaluation (≥2 points on a 3-point scale)

Analysis of Differences in Deep Learning Effects in Social Studies Based on Learner Characteristics (Gender, Career, Field) by Subject Area (History, Geography, Economics) and Proposal of Social System Improvement Plans

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
